intro: Phacelia divaricata var. congdonii, commonly known as Congdon's phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its showy blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils in open habitats such as meadows and slopes. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and it blooms from late spring to early summer. This variety is often found in arid and semi-arid regions, where it plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
